**Cause:** Ahmad and Muslim narrated from Jarir bin Abdullah al-Bajali who said: We were with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, in the early part of the day. He said: A group of people came, barefoot, naked, wearing striped woollen clothes or cloaks, girded with swords, most of them from Mudar, rather all of them from Mudar. The face of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, changed when he saw the poverty they were in. He entered then came out and ordered Bilal, who called Adhan and Iqama. He prayed then preached saying: (O mankind, fear your Lord, who created you from one soul) to the end of the verse (Indeed Allah is ever, over you, an Observer) [Al-Nisa / 1] and the verse in Al-Hashr (Fear Allah, and let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow - and fear Allah) [Al-Hashr / 18]. "Let a man give charity from his dinar, his dirham, his garment, his sa' of wheat, his sa' of dates." Until he said: "Even if with half a date." He said: A man from the Ansar came with a purse which his palm was almost unable to hold, nay it was unable. He said: Then people followed until I saw two heaps of food and clothes, until I saw the face of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, shining as if it were gold. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever establishes in Islam a good sunnah, he has its reward and the reward of those who act upon it after him without diminishing anything from their rewards. And whoever establishes in Islam a bad sunnah, upon him is its burden and the burden of those who act upon it after him without diminishing anything from their burdens."
Ahmad narrated from Hudhayfah who said: A man asked in the time of the Prophet, peace be upon him, and the people withheld. Then a man gave him, and the people gave. The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever initiates good and it is followed, he has its reward and part of the rewards of those who follow him without diminishing anything from their rewards. And whoever initiates evil and it is followed, upon him is its burden and part of the burdens of those who follow him without diminishing anything from their burdens."
Ahmad narrated from Abu Huraira who said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and he urged (charity) for him. A man said: I have such and such. He said: There remained no one in the assembly...
foot_note: None

text:
...except he gave charity, little or much. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever initiates good and it is followed, he has its reward complete, and from the rewards of those who follow it, nothing is diminished from their rewards. And whoever initiates evil and it is followed, upon him is its burden complete, and from the burdens of those who follow it, nothing is diminished from their burdens."

[61] **Hadith:** Al-Bukhari and Muslim (1) narrated from Ibn Umar that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "The upper hand is better than the lower hand."
**Cause:** Ahmad, Al-Bukhari, and Muslim narrated from Hakim bin Hizam, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I asked the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and he gave me. Then I asked him and he gave me. Then I asked him and he gave me. Then he said: "O Hakim, indeed this wealth is green and sweet. Whoever takes it with generosity of soul (without greed), it is blessed for him. And whoever takes it with expectation of soul (greed), it is not blessed for him, and he is like one who eats and is not satisfied. The upper hand is better than the lower hand." Hakim said: I said, O Messenger of Allah, by the One who sent you with the truth, I will not take anything from anyone after you until I leave the world.
Ahmad narrated from Hakim bin Hizam who said: I asked the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, for money and was persistent. He said to me: "O Hakim, how much is your asking? O Hakim, indeed this wealth is green and sweet, and yet it is the filth of people's hands. The Hand of Allah is above the hand of the giver, and the hand of the giver is above the hand of the recipient, and the lowest of hands is the hand of the recipient."

[62] **Hadith:** Al-Bukhari and Muslim (2) narrated from Amr bin al-As that he...

...heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "If a judge judges and strives (makes Ijtihad) then is correct, he has two rewards. And if he judges and strives then errs, he has one reward."
**Cause:** Ahmad narrated from Abdullah bin Amr bin al-As who said: Two disputants came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, disputing. He said to Amr: "Judge between them, O Amr." He said: You are more worthy of that than me, O Messenger of Allah. He said: "Even if!" He said: If I judge between them, what is for me? He said: "If you judge between them and hit the judgment correctly, you have ten good deeds. And if you strive and err, you have one good deed."

[63] Ahmad (1) narrated from Ubadah bin al-Samit that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Guarantee me six from yourselves, I guarantee you Paradise: Speak the truth when you speak, fulfill when you promise, deliver when you are entrusted, guard your private parts, lower your gaze, and restrain your hands."
**Cause:** Ahmad said in Al-Zuhd: Abd al-Samad told us, Abd al-Jalil told us: Al-Hasan bin Abi al-Hasan told us, said: The Children of Israel ended up with Moses, peace be upon him, and said: The Torah is too great for us, so tell us a summary of the matter that has lightness. Allah revealed: Tell them: Do not wrong each other in inheritance, let no eye of a servant enter a house until he asks permission, and let him perform ablution from food as he performs ablution for prayer. They found them light for a little while, then they did not uphold them. He said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said at that: "Accept six from me, I accept Paradise for you: whoever speaks let him not lie, whoever promises let him not break, whoever is entrusted let him not betray...

1. ...or errs, and Muslim in Book of Judgments, Chapter: Clarification of the reward of the ruler if he strives and hits or errs.

...guard your hands, your eyes, and your private parts."

[64] **Hadith:** Muslim (1) narrated from Jarir from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "He who is deprived of gentleness is deprived of good."
**Cause:** Abu Dawood narrated from Aisha who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, used to go out to the desert to these valleys. He wanted to go to the desert once, so he sent me a difficult she-camel from the camels of charity. He said to me, O Aisha: "Be gentle, for gentleness was never in anything but it adorned it, and was never removed from anything but it disgraced it."

[65] **Hadith:** Abu Dawood (2) narrated from Abu Huraira who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "By Allah, I will not accept after this day of mine a gift from anyone unless he is a Quraishi Muhajir, or an Ansari, or Dusi, or Thaqafi."
**Cause:** Ahmad narrated from Ibn Abbas that a Bedouin gifted the Prophet, peace be upon him, a gift, so he rewarded him for it. He said: "Are you satisfied?" He said: No. So he increased him. He said: "Are you satisfied?" He said: No. So he increased him. He said: "Are you satisfied?" He said: Yes. He said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "I have resolved not to accept a gift except from a Quraishi, or Ansari, or Thaqafi."
Ahmad narrated from Abu Huraira that a Bedouin gifted the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, a young camel. He compensated him for it with six young camels. He (the Bedouin) was displeased. That reached the Prophet, peace be upon him, so he praised Allah and extolled Him then said: "So-and-so gifted me a she-camel, and it is my she-camel which I know as I know some of my family; it went missing from me on the day of Zaghabat. I compensated him for it with six young camels, yet he remained displeased. I have...
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Muslim in Book of Birr, Chapter: Treating with gentleness one whose obscenity is certain. 
2. Abu Dawood in Book of Sales, Chapter: Accepting gifts. (*)

text:
...resolved not to accept a gift except from a Quraishi, or Ansari, or Thaqafi, or Dusi."

[66] **Hadith:** Al-Bukhari (1) narrated from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "Indeed Allah created mercy on the day He created it as one hundred mercies. He withheld ninety-nine mercies and sent one mercy to all His creation."
Ahmad narrated from Abu Sa'id who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Allah Almighty has one hundred mercies. He divided one part among creation, so by it people, beasts, and birds show mercy to one another."
Ahmad and Muslim narrated from Salman from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "Indeed Allah Almighty has one hundred mercies. From them is one mercy by which creation shows mercy to one another, so by it beasts show affection to their young. And He delayed ninety-nine to the Day of Resurrection."
Al-Bukhari narrated from Abu Huraira who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "Allah made mercy one hundred parts. He held back ninety-nine parts with Him and sent down one part to earth. From that part creation shows mercy to one another, so that a mare lifts its hoof from its foal fearing to hurt it."
**Cause:** Ahmad narrated from Jundub bin Abdullah al-Bajali who said: A Bedouin came, made his camel kneel, hobbled it, then prayed behind the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. When the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, prayed, he came to his camel, untied its hobble, then rode it. Then he called out: O Allah, have mercy on me and Muhammad, and do not associate anyone in our mercy. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Do you say this one is more astray or his camel? Did you not hear what he said?" They said: Yes. He said:
foot_note: 1. (1) Narrated by Al-Bukhari in Book of Riqaq, Chapter: Hope with Fear. (*)

text:
"You have restricted it (vast thing). Allah's mercy is vast. Allah created one hundred mercies, and Allah sent down one mercy by which creatures show affection to one another, Jinn, humans, and animals. And He has ninety-nine. Do you say he is more astray or his camel?"

[67] **Hadith:** Al-Tabarani in Al-Awsat and Al-Bayhaqi in Al-Shu'ab narrated from Rafi' bin Yazid al-Thaqafi that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Indeed Satan loves red, so beware of red and every garment of fame."
**Cause:** Ahmad narrated from Rafi' bin Khadij that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, saw redness appearing so he disliked it. When Rafi' bin Khadij died, they put a red velvet cover on his bier, and people wondered at that.
Ahmad (1) narrated from Rafi' bin Khadij that they went out with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, on a journey. He said: When the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, dismounted for lunch, he said: Let every man hang the halter of his camel then let it shake the trees. He said: Then we sat with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. He said: And our saddles were on our camels. He said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, raised his head and saw cloaks of ours with red wool threads. He said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Do I not see this redness has overcome you?" He said: So we stood up quickly due to the saying of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, until some of our camels bolted. We took the cloaks and removed them (the red threads) from them.

[68] **Hadith:** Ahmad and Muslim (2) narrated from Jabir who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "If one of you sees a dream he dislikes, let him spit to his left three times, and seek refuge...
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 4 / 41. 
2. Narrated by Ahmad 3 / 350 and Muslim Book of Dreams. (*)

text:
...in Allah from Satan three times, and turn from the side he was on."
Ahmad and Al-Bukhari narrated from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "If one of you sees a dream he loves, it is from Allah; let him praise Allah for it and talk about it. And if he sees other than that which he dislikes, it is from Satan; let him seek refuge in Allah from its evil and not mention it to anyone, for it will not harm him."
**Cause:** Ahmad and Muslim narrated from Jabir bin Abdullah that a man came to the Prophet, peace be upon him, and said: O Messenger of Allah, I saw in a dream that my head was cut off and was rolling, and I was following it. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "That is from Satan. If one of you sees a dream he dislikes, let him not tell it to anyone, and let him seek refuge in Allah from Satan."

[69] **Hadith:** Ahmad (1) narrated from Abu Huraira from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "If one of you sneezes, let him say 'Alhamdulillah'. If he says 'Alhamdulillah', let his brother say to him: 'Yarhamukallah'. If he is told 'Yarhamukallah', let him say: 'Yahdikumullah wa Yuslihu Balakum'."
**Cause:** Ahmad narrated from Salim bin Ubayd who said: I was with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, on a journey. A man sneezed and said: Peace be upon you. He said: "Upon you and your mother." Then he said: "If one of you sneezes, let him say 'Alhamdulillah' in every state or 'Alhamdulillah Rabb al-Alamin', and let it be said to him: 'Yarhamukallah', and let him say: 'Yaghfirullahu li wa Lakum'."

[70] **Hadith:** Ahmad, Al-Bukhari, and Muslim (2) narrated from Ibn Umar who said:

1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 2 / 353. 
2. Narrated by Ahmad 2 / 91 and Al-Bukhari in Book of Coercion Chapter: A man's oath to his companion that he is his brother if he fears he might be killed. Narrated by Muslim Book of Birr Chapter: Prohibition of injustice. (*)

text:
The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "A Muslim is a brother of a Muslim; he does not wrong him, nor forsake him, nor hand him over."
**Cause:** Ahmad narrated from Suwayd bin Hanzala who said: We went out wanting the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and Wa'il bin Hujr was with us. An enemy of his seized him. People felt reluctant to swear. I swore that he was my brother, so he let him go. We came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and I mentioned that to him. He said: "You were the most righteous of them and most truthful. You spoke the truth; a Muslim is a brother of a Muslim."

[71] **Hadith:** Ahmad (1) narrated from Ibn Umar that the Prophet, peace be upon him, forbade loneliness; that a man spends the night alone or travels alone.
Al-Bukhari narrated from Ibn Umar who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "If people knew what is in loneliness, I do not know if anyone would travel at night ever."
Ahmad narrated from Abdullah bin Amr bin al-As that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "One rider is a devil, two riders are two devils, and three are a riding party."
Ahmad narrated from Abu Huraira who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, cursed effeminate men who imitate women, masculine women who imitate men, celibate men who say they will not marry, celibate women who say that, and the one who rides in the desert alone, and the one who sleeps alone.
**Cause:** Ahmad narrated from Ibn Abbas who said: A man left Khaybar. Two men followed him, and another followed them saying: Four, four. Until he returned them. Then he caught up with the first and said: These two are devils, and I kept at them until I returned them. If you come to...

text:
...the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, convey my greetings to him and inform him that we are here gathering our charities; if they were suitable for him, we would have sent them to him. When the man arrived in Medina, he informed the Prophet, peace be upon him. At that time, the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, forbade solitude.

[72] **Hadith:** Al-Bukhari and Muslim (1) narrated from Ibn Umar that the Prophet, peace be upon him, ordered the killing of dogs. Muslim added: Until we killed the dog of a woman who came from the desert.
**Cause:** Ahmad and Al-Tabarani narrated from Abu Rafi' who said: Gabriel came asking permission to enter upon the Prophet, peace be upon him. He permitted him, but he delayed entering. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, took his robe and went to him while he was standing at the door. He said: "We permitted you." He said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah, but we do not enter a house in which there is a dog or a picture. They found a puppy in some of their houses. Abu Rafi' said: He ordered me in the morning, so I did not leave a dog in Medina but killed it. Then I saw a woman from the outskirts who had a dog barking. I felt mercy for her and left it. I came and he ordered me, so I returned to the dog and killed it.

[73] **Hadith:** Ahmad (1) narrated from Abu Kabsha al-Anmari who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "Three I swear upon: As for the three I swear upon: The wealth of a servant does not decrease by charity. No servant is wronged a wrong and bears it patiently but that Allah Almighty increases him in honor by it. And no servant opens a door of begging but that Allah Almighty opens for him a door of poverty."
**Cause:** Ahmad narrated from Abu Huraira that a man insulted Abu Bakr while the Prophet, peace be upon him, was sitting. The Prophet, peace be upon him, was wondering and smiling. When the man increased, Abu Bakr responded to some of his words.

1. (1) Narrated by Al-Bukhari in Book of Beginning of Creation, Chapter: If a fly falls into the drink of one of you. Also narrated by Muslim in Book of Musaqah: Chapter: Command to kill dogs etc.

text:
The Prophet, peace be upon him, became angry and stood up. Abu Bakr caught up with him and said: O Messenger of Allah, he was insulting me while you were sitting. When I responded to some of his words, you got angry and stood up. He said: "There was an angel with you defending you. When you responded to some of his words, Satan arrived. I was not going to sit with Satan." Then he said: "O Abu Bakr, three are all true: No servant is wronged a wrong and overlooks it for the sake of Allah Almighty but that Allah honors him with victory by it. No man opens a door of giving intending connection (Silah) by it but that Allah increases him in abundance by it. And no man opens a door of begging intending increase by it but that Allah Almighty increases him in scarcity by it."

[74] **Hadith:** Ahmad, Al-Bukhari, and Muslim (1) narrated from Jarir al-Bajali who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "He who does not show mercy will not be shown mercy."
**Cause:** Ahmad, Al-Bukhari, and Muslim narrated from Abu Huraira who said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, saw Al-Aqra' bin Habis. He (the Prophet) kissed Hasan. Al-Aqra' said: I have ten children, I never kissed any of them. The Prophet said: "Indeed, he who does not show mercy will not be shown mercy."

[75] **Hadith:** Muslim (2) narrated from Abu Ayyub from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "If you did not have sins for which Allah would forgive you, Allah would have brought a people who have sins to forgive them."
Muslim narrated from Abu Huraira who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "By the One in Whose hand is my soul, if you did not sin, Allah would have taken you away and brought a people who sin and ask forgiveness from Allah...

1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 4 / 365, Muslim in Book of Virtues, and Al-Bukhari in Book of Literature Chapter: Mercy to people and animals. 
2. Narrated by Muslim in Book of Repentance, Chapter: Dropping of sins by seeking forgiveness. Narrated by Ahmad (*)

...so He forgives them."
Al-Tabarani narrated from Ibn Abbas who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "If you did not sin, Allah would have brought a people who sin so He forgives them."
**Cause:** Ibn Asakir narrated from Anas that the companions of the Prophet, peace be upon him, complained to him that we commit sins. He said to them: "Were it not that you sin, Allah would have brought a people who sin and seek forgiveness from Allah so He forgives them."
Al-Bayhaqi in Shu'ab al-Iman narrated from Abdullah bin Amr who said: (When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake) [Surah Al-Zalzalah: 1] was revealed while Abu Bakr was sitting. Abu Bakr wept. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to him: "What makes you weep, O Abu Bakr?" He said: This Surah made me weep. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to him: "If you did not err and sin so He forgives you, Allah would create a nation after you who err and sin so He forgives them."

[76] **Hadith:** Al-Daraqutni in Al-Afrad narrated from Ibn Umar that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "It is not lawful for a Muslim to frighten a Muslim."
**Cause:** Ibn Asakir narrated from Al-Waqidi who said: The first battle Zayd bin Thabit witnessed with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was when he was fifteen years old. He was among those moving dirt that day with the Muslims. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Indeed, the boy is disabled (tired)." Sleep overcame him that day, so he slept. Umara bin Hazm came and took his weapon while he was unaware. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "O sleeper, you slept until your weapon went!" The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Who has knowledge of this boy's weapon?" Umara bin Hazm said: O Messenger of Allah! I took it. He returned it. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, forbade frightening a believer and taking his belongings, playfully or seriously.
foot_note: None

[77] **Hadith:** Muslim (1) and Al-Tirmidhi narrated from Ibn Umar who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Trim the mustaches and grow the beards."
**Cause:** Ibn al-Najjar in his History narrated from Ibn Abbas who said: A delegation of non-Arabs came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, having shaved their beards and left their mustaches. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Oppose them; trim the mustaches and grow the beards."
Ibn Sa'd narrated from Ubaydullah bin Abdullah who said: A Magian came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, having grown his mustache and cut his beard. He said to him: "Who commanded you this?" He said: My Lord. He said: "But my Lord commanded me to trim my mustache and grow my beard."
Abu al-Qasim bin Bishr in his Amali narrated from Abu Huraira: A Magian entered upon the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, having shaved his beard and grown his mustache. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Woe to you, who commanded you this?" He said: Kisra commanded me with it. He said: "But my Lord Almighty commanded me to grow my beard and trim my mustache."

[78] **Hadith:** Al-Bukhari (2) narrated from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "That the belly of one of you fills with pus is better for him than to fill with poetry."

[89] **Hadith:** The Four (1) narrated from Sakhr al-Ghamidi from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "O Allah, bless my Ummah in its early hours."
**Cause:** Al-Khatib and Ibn al-Najjar in Tarikh Baghdad narrated from Anas who said: I went out with the Prophet, peace be upon him, one night in the months of Ramadan. He passed by fires in the houses of the Ansar. He said: "O Anas, what are these fires?" I said: O Messenger of Allah, the Ansar are taking Suhoor. He said: "O Allah, bless my Ummah in its early hours."

[80] **Hadith:** Ahmad, Al-Bukhari, Abu Dawood, Al-Tirmidhi, Al-Nasa'i, and Ibn Majah (2) narrated from Ibn Abbas who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, forbade drinking from the mouth of the water skin.

[81] **Hadith:** Al-Bukhari and Muslim (1) narrated from Abu Huraira who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "O Allah, I take a covenant with You which You will not break for me; I am only a human. Any believer whom I harmed, insulted, or flogged, make it for him a prayer, purity, and a means of nearness by which You bring him near on the Day of Resurrection."
Ahmad and Muslim narrated from Jabir bin Abdullah: I heard the Prophet, peace be upon him, say: "I am only a human, and I stipulated on my Lord Almighty: Any slave from the Muslims whom I insulted or cursed, let it be for him purity and reward."
Ahmad narrated from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "O Allah, I take a covenant with You which You will not break for me. I am only a human. **Cause:** Ahmad narrated from Anas that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, gave a man to Hafsa daughter of Umar and said to her: Guard him. He said: Hafsa did so, but the man left. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, entered and said: "O Hafsa, what did the man do?" She said: I was distracted from him, O Messenger of Allah, so he left. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "May Allah cut your hand." She raised...

The girl said: The Prophet of Allah, peace be upon him, prayed against me that my age not increase, so now my age will never increase, or she said my generation. Umm Sulaym went out hurriedly twisting her headcover until she met the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to her: "What is wrong, O Umm Sulaym?" She said: O Prophet of Allah! Did you pray against my orphan girl? He said: "And what is that, O Umm Sulaym?" She said: She claimed you prayed that her age not increase and her generation not increase. He said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, laughed then said: "O Umm Sulaym, do you not know my condition with my Lord? I stipulated on my Lord, saying: I am only a human; I am pleased as humans are pleased and I get angry as humans get angry. Anyone from my Ummah whom I prayed against with a prayer they do not deserve, make it for them purification, purity, and nearness by which You bring them near on the Day of Resurrection."
Ahmad narrated from the uncle of Abu al-Sawwar who said: I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and people following him, so I followed with them. He said: He surprised me, so I admired the people running. He said: And the people stayed (stopped). He said: My soul told me to go to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, when I wake up. He said: Gabriel descended...

[82] **Hadith:** Al-Tirmidhi (1) narrated from Aisha that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "It is not fitting for a people among whom is Abu Bakr that anyone else leads them."
**Cause:** Abu al-Abbas al-Zawzani narrated in the book "Shajarat al-Aql" from Al-Qasim bin Muhammad who said: Something happened among the Ansar from the people of the Awali. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, went to reconcile between them. They returned, and the people had prayed Asr. He said: "Who led the people in Asr?" They said: Abu Bakr. He said: "You did well. It is not fitting for a people among whom is Abu Bakr that anyone else leads them."

[83] **Hadith:** Al-Bukhari (2) narrated from Abu Huraira who said: Abu al-Qasim, peace be upon him, said: "Name yourselves with my name but do not use my Kunya (Abu al-Qasim)."
**Cause:** Ahmad, Al-Bukhari, and Muslim narrated from Jabir bin Abdullah that a man from the Ansar had a boy born to him, and he wanted to name him Muhammad. He came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, who said: "Name yourselves with my name but do not use my Kunya."

The man said: I did not mean you, O Messenger of Allah, I only meant So-and-so. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Name yourselves with my name but...

Ahmad narrated from Ali: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "Every prophet has disciples, and my disciple is Al-Zubayr."
**Cause:** Ahmad, Al-Bukhari, and Muslim narrated from Jabir bin Abdullah who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Who will bring me news of the people on the Day of Ahzab?" Al-Zubayr said: I. Then he said: "Who will bring me news of the people?" Al-Zubayr said: I. He said: "Who will bring me news of the people?" Al-Zubayr said: I. He said: "Every prophet has a disciple, and indeed my disciple is Al-Zubayr."

[85] **Hadith:** Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Al-Tirmidhi, and Ibn Majah (2) narrated from Ali who said: I never heard the Prophet, peace be upon him, ransom anyone with his parents except Sa'd. I heard him on the Day of Uhud saying: "Shoot, Sa'd, may my father and mother be your ransom."

[86] **Hadith:** Ahmad (1) narrated from Abdullah bin Mas'ud that Abu Bakr and Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, gave him glad tidings that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever is pleased to read the Quran fresh as it was revealed, let him read according to the reading of Ibn Umm Abd."
Ahmad narrated from Umar bin al-Mustaliq who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever loves to read the Quran fresh as it was revealed, let him read according to the reading of Ibn Umm Abd."
**Cause:** Abdullah bin Ahmad said in Zawa'id al-Zuhd: Abu al-Kamil Fudayl bin al-Husayn told me, Al-Mufaddal al-Kufi Abu Abd al-Rahman told us, Ibrahim bin al-Muhajir told us, Ibrahim al-Nakha'i told us from Ubayda, from Abdullah bin Mas'ud who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, ascended the pulpit and said: "Read." I read Surah Al-Nisa to him until I reached (from Him when We bring from every nation a witness and we bring you against these as a witness) [Surah Al-Nisa: 41]. He nudged me with his foot, so I raised my head and saw his eyes flowing (with tears). He said: "Whoever loves to read the Quran as it was revealed, let him read it according to the reading of Ibn Umm Abd."
Ahmad narrated from Umar bin al-Khattab: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, used to converse at night with Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, about the affair of the Muslims, and I was with him. One night he conversed with him, and I was with him. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, went out, and we went out with him. Behold, a man was standing praying in the mosque. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, stood listening to his reading. When we almost recognized him, the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever is pleased to read the Quran fresh as it was revealed, let him read it according to the reading of Ibn Umm Abd."

[88] **Hadith:** Ahmad and Al-Tirmidhi (2) (who classified it Hasan), and Al-Hakim narrated from Ubayy bin Ka'b: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "Were it not for the Migration, I would have been a man from the Ansar. **Cause:** Ibn Abi Shaybah, Al-Munawi, and Muslim narrated from Abdullah bin Zayd bin Asim who said: When Allah granted His Messenger booty on the Day of Hunayn, he distributed among people to reconcile their hearts, but did not distribute nor give the Ansar anything. And you were divided and Allah united you by me? And poor and Allah enriched you by me?" He said: Whenever he said something, they said: Allah and His Messenger are most benevolent. He said: "What prevents you from answering?" They said: Allah and His Messenger are most benevolent. He said: "If you wished, you could say: You came to us such and such. Are you not pleased that people go with sheep and camels, and you go with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, to your dwellings? Were it not for the Migration, I would have been a man from the Ansar. If...

[89] **Hadith:** Ahmad and Muslim (1) narrated from Abu Sa'id who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Do not insult my companions, for by the One in Whose hand is my soul, if one of you spent the like of Uhud in gold, he would not reach the mudd (handful) of one of them nor half of it." Al-Barqani narrated it in his Mustakhraj on Sahih (Muslim), saying: "If one of you spent every day the like of Uhud in gold."
**Cause:** Ahmad narrated from Anas who said: There was a dispute between Khalid bin al-Walid and Abd al-Rahman bin Awf. Khalid said to Abd al-Rahman bin Awf: You claim superiority over us by days you preceded us in. We were informed that this was mentioned to the Prophet, peace be upon him, so he said: "Leave my companions alone for me. By the One in Whose hand is my soul, if you spent the like of Uhud or like mountains in gold, you would not reach their deeds."
Ibn Asakir narrated from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri who said: There was something between Abd al-Rahman bin Awf and Khalid bin al-Walid, so Khalid insulted him. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Do not insult anyone of my companions, for if one of you spent the like of Uhud in gold, he would not reach the mudd of one of them nor half of it."
Ibn Asakir narrated from Abu Huraira who said: Something that happens between people happened between Abd al-Rahman bin Awf and Khalid bin al-Walid. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Leave my companions alone for me, for if one of you spent the like of Uhud in gold, he would not reach the mudd of one of them nor half of it."

Ibn Asakir narrated in the biography of Khalid bin al-Walid from Al-Hasan who said: There was something between Al-Zubayr and Khalid bin al-Walid. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "What is the matter with you and my companions? By the One in Whose hand is my soul, if one of you spent the like of Uhud in gold, he would not reach the like of the deed of one of them for a single day." Ibn Asakir said: What is preserved is that the opponent of Khalid was Abd al-Rahman bin Awf and Ammar.
Ibn Asakir narrated in the biography of Ibn Awf from Al-Hasan who said: There was speech between Abd al-Rahman bin Awf and Khalid bin al-Walid. By the One in Whose hand is my soul, if one of you spent the like of Uhud in gold, he would not reach half of them." He said: Then after that, there was something between Abd al-Rahman and Al-Zubayr. Khalid said: O Prophet of Allah, Allah! You forbade me regarding Abd al-Rahman, and here Al-Zubayr is insulting him. He said: "They are the people of Badr, and some of them are more entitled to each other."

[90] **Hadith:** Al-Tirmidhi (1) narrated from Burayda who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "No one of my companions dies in a land but he will be resurrected as a leader or light for them on the Day of Resurrection."
**Cause:** Ibn Asakir narrated from Abdullah bin al-Hasan who said: Amir bin al-Akwa' died in Wadi al-Qura. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "No man of my companions dies in a land of lands but Allah resurrects him on the Day of Resurrection as the master of the people of that land."

[91] **Hadith:** Al-Tirmidhi (1) narrated from Sa'id bin Zayd bin Amr bin Nufayl from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "Ten are in Paradise: Abu Bakr is in Paradise, Umar is in Paradise, Ali, Uthman, Al-Zubayr, Talha, Abd al-Rahman, Ubayda, and Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas." He said: He counted these nine and was silent about the tenth. The people said: We adjure you by Allah, O Abu al-A'war, who is the tenth? He said: You adjured me by Allah. Abu al-A'war is in Paradise. He said: He is Sa'id bin Zayd bin Amr bin Nufayl.
**Cause:** Ibn Asakir narrated from Sa'id bin Zayd who said: I heard Abu Bakr al-Siddiq say to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him: I wish I saw a living man from the people of Paradise. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to him: "This is I, from the people of Paradise." He said: O Messenger of Allah, I do not doubt you. So he counted for him and said: "O Abu Bakr, I am from the people of Paradise, you are from the people of Paradise, Umar is from the people of Paradise, Uthman is from the people of Paradise, Ali is from the people of Paradise, Talha is from the people of Paradise, Al-Zubayr is from the people of Paradise, Abd al-Rahman bin Awf is from the people of Paradise, Sa'd bin Malik is from the people of Paradise, and the tenth I have named." They adjured him by Allah: Who is the tenth? He said: "I am."

[92] **Hadith:** Muslim (2) narrated from Abu Huraira from the Messenger of Allah that he said: "By the One in Whose hand is the soul of Muhammad, no one of this nation, Jew or Christian, hears of me then dies without believing in what I was sent with, but he will be of the inhabitants of the Fire."

...people at my feet."
**Cause:** Al-Tabarani narrated from Jubayr bin Mut'im who said: Abu Jahl bin Hisham said when he returned to Mecca leaving Hamza: O assembly of Quraysh, indeed Muhammad has settled in Yathrib and sent his vanguards. He only wants to strike something of you. So beware of passing his way and approaching him, for he is like a predatory lion. If he restricts you, you will reject him as ticks are rejected from spoils. By Allah, he has magic; I never saw him nor anyone of his companions but I saw Satan with them. You have known the two sons of Qayla; he is an enemy seeking help from an enemy.
Mut'im bin Adi said to him: O Abu al-Hakam, by Allah I have never seen anyone more truthful in tongue nor truer in promise than your brother whom you expelled. If you have done what you have done, be the most refraining people from him.
Abu Sufyan bin al-Harith said: Be most severe in what you were upon. For if the two sons of Qayla overcome you, they will not observe in you any bond or covenant. If you obey them, make them join the news of Kinana (destroy them), or expel Muhammad from among them so he becomes alone and unique. As for the two sons of Qayla, by Allah they and destruction in humiliation are but equal. I will suffice you their seriousness. He said: I will grant a side of me rough upon what was of near and far. The men of Khazraj are people of humiliation when jest becomes serious.
That reached the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him: "By the One in Whose hand is my soul, I will kill them, crucify them, and guide them while they dislike. I am a mercy sent by Allah Almighty, and He will not take me until Allah manifests His religion. I have five names: I am Muhammad, I am Ahmad, I am Al-Mahi by whom Allah erases disbelief, I am Al-Hashir who gathers people at his hands, and I am Al-Aqib." Ahmad bin Salih said: I hope the hadith is authentic.

[96] **Hadith:** Al-Hakim (1) narrated from Ibn Mas'ud who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "I am pleased for my Ummah what Ibn Umm Abd is pleased for it."
**Cause:** Ibn Asakir said: It was narrated from another perspective with its cause in which it appeared. Then he narrated from Amr bin Hurayth who said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, said to Abdullah bin Mas'ud: "Read." He said: I read while it was revealed to you? He said: "I love to hear it from another." He started Al-Nisa until he reached (from Him when We bring from every nation a witness and we bring you against these as a witness [Surah Al-Nisa: 41]. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, wept, and Abdullah stopped. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to him: "Speak." He praised Allah in the beginning of his speech, extolled Allah, prayed upon the Prophet, peace be upon him, and testified the testimony of truth. He said: We are pleased with Allah as Lord, Islam as religion, and I am pleased for you what Allah and His Messenger are pleased with. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "I am pleased for you what Ibn Umm Abd is pleased for you."

[97] **Hadith:** Ahmad, Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, and Al-Tirmidhi (2) narrated from Jabir who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "War is deception."
**Cause:** Ibn Abi Shaybah narrated from Urwa who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said on the Day of Qurayza: "War is deception." He said: There was a man among the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, called Mas'ud, and he was a slanderer. When it was the Day of the Trench, the people of Qurayza sent to Abu Sufyan: Send us men to be in our fortresses so we fight Muhammad from the side of Medina and you fight from the side of the Trench. That was hard on the Prophet, peace be upon him...

...to fight from two fronts. He said to Mas'ud: "O Mas'ud, we have sent to Banu Qurayza to send to Abu Sufyan to send them men, so when they come to them, they fight them." He said: No sooner had he heard that from the Prophet, peace be upon him, than he could not control himself until he came to Abu Sufyan and told him. He said: Muhammad spoke the truth, by Allah, he never lied. So he did not send anyone to them.
Ibn Jarir narrated in Tahdhib al-Athar from Ibn Shihab who said: Qurayza sent to Abu Sufyan and those with him from the Confederates on the Day of the Trench: Stand firm, for we will raid the heartland of Muslims from behind them. Nu'aym bin Mas'ud al-Ashja'i heard that, and he was with Uyayna bin Hisn when Banu Qurayza sent that to the Confederates. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Perhaps we ordered them to do that." Nu'aym stood with that word of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, to tell Ghatafan about it. Nu'aym was a man who could not hold a story. When Nu'aym turned to go to Ghatafan, Umar bin al-Khattab said: O Messenger of Allah, this which you said: is it from Allah so you command it, or is it an opinion you saw? For the matter of Banu Qurayza is too easy for you to say something that affects you. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Rather, it is an opinion I saw; indeed war is deception." Then the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, sent after Nu'aym and said: "Did you see what you heard me mention just now? Withhold from it and do not mention it to anyone." Nu'aym left until he came to Uyayna bin Hisn and those with him. He said to them: Did you know that Muhammad ever said anything but truth? They said: No. He said: He said to me regarding what Banu Qurayza sent to you: Perhaps we ordered them to do that. Then he forbade me to mention it to you. Uyayna went until he met Abu Sufyan and told him. He said: You are only in a plot from Banu Qurayza. So they departed, and that was their defeat. Thereby people permitted deception in war. Ibn Jarir narrated from Ibn Abbas who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, sent a man from his companions to a man from the Jews and ordered him to kill him. He said to him: O Messenger, I cannot do that unless you permit me (to lie). The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to him: "War is only deception, so do what you want."

[98] **Hadith:** Ibn Jarir in his Tahdhib, Al-Khara'iti in Masawi' al-Akhlaq, and Al-Bayhaqi in Shu'ab al-Iman narrated via Shahr bin Hawshab from Al-Zibriqan, from Al-Nawwas bin Sam'an who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Why do I see you falling into lies as moths fall into fire? Lo, every lie is written against the son of Adam except in three: a man lying to his wife to please her, a man lying for war, for war is deception, and a man lying to reconcile between two men, for Allah Almighty says: (No good is there in much of their private conversation, except for those who enjoin charity or that which is right or conciliation between people)."

When they came, the Prophet, peace be upon him, mentioned to them what the man told him. They said: He lied, by Allah, nothing of what he says happened. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "You fall into lies as moths fall into fire." Then he said: "Lying is written all inevitably as a lie, except that a man lies in war, for war is deception; and that a man lies between two men reconciling between them; and that he lies to his family, meaning his wife."
